revised_title: Decomposition of Paraffins Under Heat and Pressure
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the combined action of heat and pressure on paraffins, discovering that they can be decomposed into liquid hydrocarbons. They found that the transformation depends on the complexity of the paraffin's constitution and that only certain paraffins can be decomposed. The process has implications for understanding the composition of solid paraffins and their potential applications.
